image.altText: A woman and a man in blazers look at budget papers on a desk.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's net debt will reach more than $12 billion next financial year, with the budget forecasting a further increase to $14 billion by 2029.

title.children: NT debt approaching record $14b by 2029 as CLP delivers first budget

image.altText: A woman standing next to a teen boy at his school graduation

props.synopsis: There are concerns many young people with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder in Australia are falling through the cracks because of a lack of diagnostic and support services.

title.children: Australia's first fetal alcohol spectrum disorder clinical guidelines released

image.altText: A high-angle shot of a white woman with grey hair, in a blue patterned dress. She has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Women living with HIV are calling for an increase in HIV testing for women and that more funding be directed to programs in regional Australia that provide support to women with the virus.

title.children: Why so many women are diagnosed late with HIV

image.altText: Large packets of a light brown powdery substance with red labels on top, stacked on a table.

props.synopsis: Kava smuggling into the Northern Territory's remote Indigenous communities is on the rise, with local leaders fearing the black market price of the drink is draining family finances and fuelling social problems.

title.children: Smuggled kava is smashing family finances in the remote NT, leaders say

image.altText: Aerial view of jail facility at Holtze, near Darwin.

props.synopsis: Executive incident reports from the Darwin Correctional Centre have been released to the ABC following a Freedom of Information request, revealing a series of serious events within a 24-day period.

title.children: Documents reveal violent assaults and use of 'chemical agents' at NT prison

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair surrounded by this family

props.synopsis: For the first time in a decade, Daniel Lalara has been able to express himself through song, with the help of artificial intelligence.

title.children: A degenerative disease stole Daniel's voice, now AI is bringing it back

image.altText: A woman rushing in a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the $2 billion residential care system finds children in three of the biggest states are being preyed upon by child sex abusers when they should be safe in state care.

title.children: Girl in 24/7 care 'so far gone' she may die from sexual exploitation

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The trade war between the US and China isn't fully over, but a deal between the two sides to slash reciprocal tariffs is a major capitulation from Donald Trump.

title.children: No matter how he spins it, this is a major capitulation from Trump

image.altText: A headshot of Diddy wearing a white suit, standing in front of a grey background

props.synopsis: The prosecution argues Sean "Diddy" Combs used his power to coerce victims into marathon drug-fuelled orgies, while the defence says its client is merely a "swinger" with unconventional sexual proclivities.

title.children: Sex worker tells of 'attack' on girlfriend on Diddy trial's first day

image.altText: a woman holds a us flag

props.synopsis: The first group of 49 white South Africans to be granted refugee status by the Trump administration have been flown to the US.

title.children: First group of white South Africans fly to US under Trump refugee plan

image.altText: A man and a woman sit in a room with a computer, paper on the walls and stacks of documents. They are holding a folder.

props.synopsis: There's little this hardware store owner can do to stop Bunnings building next door, but when rivals want to move in on the warehouse giant's turf, it is a different story.

title.children: This couple sold worms, they say Bunnings crushed their business

image.altText: A group of protesters in Hostage Square holding pictures of Edan, a young man.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old has been reunited with his family at the Israeli border after 580 days in captivity.

title.children: Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander released by Hamas

image.altText: Hostages protest

props.synopsis: It has been more than 580 days since 251 people were taken hostage by Hamas on October 7, 2023. Here's why the most recent release is significant.

title.children: What we know about the remaining hostages in Gaza

image.altText: two women, one holding a greens pamphlet, talk to media

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Watson-Brown has claimed Ryan in inner-Brisbane. She's the only Greens MP to retain their seat.

title.children: Larissa Waters won't rule out leadership tilt as Greens claim sole election victory

image.altText: A Boeing aircraft flies in the sky

props.synopsis: The US president has dismissed ethical concerns over accepting a $400-million luxury aircraft from the Qatari royal family.

title.children: Trump says it would be 'stupid' not to accept jet from Qatari royal family

image.altText: A woman in a yellow

props.synopsis: For Vietnam, one of the world's most export-reliant economies, the stakes of its negotiations with US President Donald Trump on the future of his tariffs plan could not be higher.

title.children: 'A lot of us here are worried': The far-reaching impact of Trump's tariffs

image.altText: An office worker talks on his phone as he looks the stock board at the Australian Securities Exchange

props.synopsis: A US-China trade deal that includes tariff cuts has sent US stock markets soaring. The Australian market has also jumped higher in response. Follow live.

title.children: US-China tariffs 'deal' spurs stock surge, Australian market lifts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Consumer sentiment recovers slightly from last month's tariff-related decline
Pharma stocks on watch as Trump signs executive order
US stocks leap as existential economic threat reduced

image.altText: The torso and arms of a boy infected with measles showing a rash on his skin.

props.synopsis: Measles cases have reached the highest number of infections nationwide in six years. Health professionals are urging vaccination to prevent further spread.

title.children: Measles cases across the country highest we've seen in six years

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of a for-sale sign, which has a large sold sticker plastered across it.

props.synopsis: Victoria lost over 24,000 rentals last year — or 3.6 per cent of the state's entire rental stock — as an investor sell-off gained pace.

title.children: Victoria loses 24,000 rentals in a year as investors flee market

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: The South Australian government invited some of the nation's top media and business executives to enjoy corporate hospitality at this year’s LIV Golf tournament, prompting questions about use of taxpayer funds.

title.children: FOI documents reveal 'boys club' guest list for exclusive LIV Golf suite

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing a tie sits in an office looking very serious.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Canberrans are having to pay back tens of thousands of dollars at short notice, after finding out they're no longer eligible for home stamp duty concessions.

title.children: These Canberrans received a home stamp duty concession. Now they owe thousands

image.altText: A smiling woman with short, blonde hair stands in a park in front of a cityscape.

props.synopsis: The federal Liberal Party will have a new woman in parliament with Mary Aldred claiming Monash after a tight three-way contest in the regional Victorian seat.

title.children: 'Humbled' Mary Aldred takes Monash for Liberals after complex vote count

image.altText: MH17 wreckage

props.synopsis: It ruled that Russia was responsible for the downing of a Malaysian airliner over Ukraine that killed all 298 people on board, including 38 Australians.

title.children: Russia responsible for downing flight MH17, UN aviation agency says

image.altText: kim kardashian with a short hair cut looks to the left of screen

props.synopsis: The star will come face to face with the gang who allegedly bound and gagged her in a Paris hotel room in 2016 and stole $15 million of jewellery.

title.children: Kim Kardashian to testify against alleged 'grandpa robbers' who tied her up at gunpoint

image.altText: Pope Leo, dressed in white, greets crowds from the balcony, with his hand raised.

props.synopsis: Amid global conflicts, the new pope will need to forge new bonds. Experts say he has the background and the skills that will demonstrate that he's up to the task.

title.children: Pope Francis was close to other religious leaders. Will Pope Leo follow suit?

image.altText: Luka Doncic and LeBron James laugh together while sitting on the bench at a Lakers NBA game.

props.synopsis: The ping-pong balls bail out the Dallas Mavericks, gifting them the top pick in the NBA Draft despite minuscule odds just months after trading away Luka Dončić.

title.children: LeBron can only laugh as disastrous trade nets Dallas potential superstar

image.altText: Tammy Franks looking stern in a pink blazer in front of microphones

props.synopsis: South Australian Greens politician Tammy Franks says she's resigning from the party and will sit as an independent until the next election.

title.children: Breaking: SA Greens MP Tammy Franks resigns from party

image.altText: Knitted cream baby shoes.

props.synopsis: Women's health experts have welcomed new national guidelines for the treatment of miscarriage, recurrent miscarriage and ectopic pregnancy up to 14 weeks gestation.

title.children: New national guidelines for miscarriage and early pregnancy loss released

image.altText: A burned out car found by police after a shooting in Yennora

props.synopsis: A man is in a stable condition in hospital after a gunman opened fired on him inside his work truck at Yennora late Monday night.

title.children: Man shot, cars set alight in suspected gangland shooting

image.altText: large group of people protesting in davao city holding signs saying bring duterte home

props.synopsis: With 80 per cent of votes counted in an unofficial tally, Rodrigo Duterte was winning the Davao mayoral contest with eight times more votes than his nearest rival.

title.children: Former Philippine president Duterte wins mayoral election from jail cell

image.altText: Dami stretches her arms up in celebration after finishing singing a song, while wearing a white bedazzled gown on stage.

props.synopsis: As Go-Jo prepares to represent Australia at Eurovision 2025, we look back over a decade of our contributions to the song contest and consider where to from here.

title.children: From Dami Im to the Milkshake Man: 10 years of Australia in Eurovision

image.altText: The scene of a car crash at night.

props.synopsis: A teenager, who pleaded guilty to culpable driving causing death, is jailed over a crash on the Barton Highway in Canberra which led to the deaths of a 19-year-old and a 14-year-old.

title.children: Teenager sentenced over Barton Highway crash that killed two

image.altText: Mitchell Starc and Alyssa Healy push their bags through the airport.

props.synopsis: Australian players who flew home last weekend could be back in India in a matter of days as the Indian Premier League prepares to resume after a ceasefire between India and Pakistan was announced.

title.children: 'A lot of anxiety' as Australian players decide whether to return to IPL
